Literature Review: Human bodies in extreme environments have been a subject of interest for anthropologists and researchers for over a century. The ability of humans to adapt to various ecological pressures has been a crucial aspect of survival and survival strategies. This review aims to provide an overview of the current understanding of human adaptation to extreme conditions of heat, cold, and high altitude, as well as recent research on human adaptation, acclimatization, and resilience in the face of climate change and structural inequality.
